subject: literacy
name: Vocabulary
description: Building age appropriate vocabulary for children is the first step in language literacy. Vocabulary expands as the child grows.

subject: literacy
name: Comprehension
description: Children should be able to understand and comprehend a text. This includes understanding the meaning of words and sentences, phrases, rhymes and idioms as they grow up.

subject: literacy
name: Akshara Knowledge
description: Basic ability to read and write a language involves recognizing the aksharas of the language. Child should be able to recognize (read) the aksharas and their sounds, as well as write the aksharas.

subject: literacy
name: Decoding & Fluency
description: In order to read and write fluently, child must be able to break the words into syllables, and reconstruct them. As they become fluent, they should be able to recognize sight words, regular words and spell based on phonetic sounds.

subject: literacy
name: Reading Comprehension
description: Children should be able to understand and comprehend written text. This includes understanding the meaning of words and sentences, phrases, rhymes and idioms as they grow up.

subject: literacy
name: Expression
description: Children should be able to express themselves (either through speaking or writing) in a given context and also able to converse with others
